Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the Board's decision based on credibility and availability of state protection
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility finding due to contradictions and omissions in testimony and forms
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Testimony, written statements, Personal Information Form (PIF), port of entry statements
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Refugee status due to threats in home country
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility issues and failure to seek state protection
Crimes.Application_Error: Omission of key information in application forms and contradictory statements
Crimes.Review_Outcome: No re-evaluation of evidence permitted; decision upheld
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None identified – court found evidence was properly considered
Crimes.Application_Factor: Inconsistent narratives regarding persecution and lack of engagement with state protection
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board’s credibility assessment and conclusions on state protection were reasonable
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA sections related to refugee eligibility and misrepresentation
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Judicial review dismissed; no serious question certified
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility and failure to test state protection in Mexico
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Contradictions in testimony and omissions in forms
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process found to be procedurally fair
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not applicable – issue was omission and inconsistency, not forged documents
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Significant inconsistencies in identity of persecutors and timeline of events
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Board's decision
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada (Federal Court review of IRB decision)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Applicants did not seek state protection before leaving Mexico
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose material facts in forms and testimony

Crimes.Crime_Name: Making false statements to an immigration officer
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the Board's decision based on applicant's credibility and state protection availability
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility finding due to contradictions at entry and in forms
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Port of entry statements, testimony, application forms
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Refugee status due to threats from PRI members in Mexico
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistencies in statements about persecutors and lack of proof of ineffective state protection
Crimes.Application_Error: Contradictory statements at port of entry and omissions in forms
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Decision upheld; no re-evaluation of evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None – court found findings supported by record
Crimes.Application_Factor: Failure to provide consistent account and test state protection
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether credibility and state protection findings were reasonable
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Credibility defects and untested state protection
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent identification of persecutors and timeline discrepancies
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Material contradictions between entry statements and later testimony
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Board’s findings
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to pursue local remedies in Mexico
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose key details at entry and in forms

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to disclose material facts in Personal Information Form
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of negative credibility finding and failure to rebut presumption of state protection
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Credibility undermined by omissions and contradictions in PIF and testimony
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Personal Information Form (PIF), oral testimony, documentary evidence
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 107 of IRPA (failure to disclose material facts)
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution by Mexican political party members
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Omissions in PIF and failure to seek state protection
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to disclose knowledge of fraud and inconsistent political party affiliation dates
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None – court found evidence was adequately assessed
Crimes.Application_Factor: Material omissions in PIF and lack of effort to access state protection
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether omissions and credibility issues justified refusal
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility and failure to avail oneself of state protection
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Omission of material facts in PIF and inconsistent timelines
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Serious inconsistencies in narrative and omissions in official forms
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that Board’s findings were unreasonable
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Did not seek protection in Mexico prior to coming to Canada
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose material facts in Personal Information Form
